other_tests.findings: Pathological examination revealed no evidence of tumor in several biopsies. A fifth biopsy showed a tiny focus of adenocarcinoma (Gleason score 6 out of 10).
other_tests.changes_over_time: No significant changes until the last biopsy, which revealed the presence of a low-grade adenocarcinoma.

other_tests.date: Two weeks later from initial evaluation
other_tests.findings: Indeterminate lesions were noted in the lumbar spine and uptake in a rib and skull; thought to possibly indicate dental disease.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A follow-up bone scan showed no changes or new uptake since the previous study.

other_tests.findings: No enhancement of the lesion in the L3 vertebral body, noted potential benign features.

other_tests.date: Three months after the initial evaluation
other_tests.findings: Adenocarcinoma with Gleason score 7 identified in all cores taken from the anterior prostate; one minute focus of adenocarcinoma (score 6) also found.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The latest biopsy indicated a larger tumor volume (Gleason score 7) compared to earlier findings with only minimal cancer.

other_tests.date: Six months after the initial evaluation
other_tests.findings: A 2-cm focus of adenocarcinoma was seen confined to the prostate with a Gleason score of 7. Negative resection margins.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The carcinoma was diagnosed after the elevated PSA levels and TTMB findings; no prior significant findings of cancer.
